sentences.sentence: Members of the UN General Assembly have voted overwhelmingly to condemn Russia's annexation of four Ukrainian regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's the strongest show of support yet for Ukraine from the UN body, calling on Russia to reverse its actions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 143 countries voted for the measure, with only five against amid 35 abstentions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This UN member state has not only put its neighbor in its crosshairs, but also put a bullseye in this institution's core principle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: One country cannot take the territory of another by force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Despite a major U.S. diplomatic effort to bolster support for the motion, 35 countries, including India and China, abstained.

sentences.sentence: Russia's ambassador to the UN said, the West is completely deaf to the problems of the global South and calls to finally address them.

sentences.sentence: Last month, Russia formally announced the annexation of four partially occupied provinces of eastern and southern Ukraine.

sentences.sentence: Voters in Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhia had, according to Moscow, overwhelmingly backed joining Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Opening the second day of the defense minister's meeting here in NATO in Brussels, the Secretary

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: General of NATO, Jens Stoltenberg, and the United States Defense Secretary welcomed the United Nations vote of condemning Russia's illegal so-called referendums in Ukraine and demanded that Moscow reverses that. At the same time, NATO allies say that they will keep the course of supporting Kiev militarily and they will discuss of how they can provide them with more air defense systems. But at the same time, many members of NATO say that they are very much worried that they cannot, they won't be able to keep that pledge because they will have their own stockpiles empty at home and they will stay unprotected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But NATO are going to discuss also this, how they will replenish their own stockpiles as soon as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Over two-thirds of all wild animals have died in the last 50 years, according to the World Wildlife Fund. It's an astonishingly fast rate, one that has also led to the extinction of countless mammals, birds, fish and other creatures. Latin America with its large forests has been hit the hardest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The decline is global but there are some regions that are affected much more heavily. 94% decline in the Latin American continent. It is not totally surprising because the continent contains tropical regions today contains so much more biodiversity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So it's obvious that the decline is therefore stronger, higher in those regions, compared to Europe, where we have recorded a 15% decline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But the reason is that Europe has lost its wildlife much before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's estimated that 17% of virgin forest has been lost in the last 50 years.

sentences.sentence: We got to abandon this delusional idea that we can continue to take nature for granted.

And if you don't take, if you don't change course and become, can be neutral on one hand for climate and nature positive in terms of biodiversity, we will pay even more consequences and the price will be even higher in the years to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
